results.title: Epilepsy: a label for life
results.brief_description: Epilepsy arouses feelings of prejudice and fear amongst members of the community, mainly based on ignorance. Discussed are the types of epilepsy, and use of drugs in treatment. The film also deals with the social and employment problems encountered by epileptics.

results.title: Epaves
results.brief_description: Shows the underwater life that is discovered during a trip 130 feet below the surface of the sea when exploring shipwrecks near Toulon in the Mediterranean sea. Two deep-sea divers, equipped with special cameras and other equipment, record the lively activity that takes place among the fish and undersea flora and fauna as the men inspect the shipwrecks.

results.title: Environmental awareness
results.brief_description: This film is a series of finger paintings which demonstrate how the countryside and people are affected by the growth of industry and its consequential pollution. Without words, the film uses music to express mood changes, highlighting environmental situations that emphasise the immediacy of environmental problems today.

results.title: Environment in the balance
results.brief_description: Shows how geological, topographical and social developments in Britain have helped to shape its present environment and discusses the problems of industrial expansion, population growth and pollution.

results.title: The Environment game
results.creator_credit: Michael Blakstad and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: Technological progress, essential to the economy of an industrial nation, must be subject to checks and controls to prevent the destruction of landscapes and pollution of the quality of life. Using schoolchildren to represent the various interests concerned, the film debates the problems, with visits to various locations to illustrate the issues at stake.

results.title: Environment 1990
results.creator_credit: Hugh Macdonald, David H. Fowler and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: Depicts the effects of man upon his environment through mainly visual images. Emphasises the individual’s responsibility in protecting the environment for future generations Credits include: photography by Sam Grau; music by Tony Baker and sound by Kit Rollings

results.title: Entr'acte
results.brief_description: A humorous cinematic poem attempting to capture all the images and associations of carnival, which dissolve into each other in the dreams of a young man who has just returned from an evening at the fair. There is no plot, each image suggesting the one to follow. This is one of the most celebrated of French avant-garde films. Made originally for a ballet called “Relache” (i.e. performance suspended) it was thus a joke within a joke - an entr’acte or intermission in a non-existent performance. No spoken word, this film’s story was written by Francis Picabia with music by Erik Satie

results.title: Enthronement of the Archbishop of York
results.brief_description: Some of the recordings made at the enthronement of Archbishop Coggan in York Minster from the arrival of the Archbishop through to his installation and enthronement. Some explanation of cathedral traditions is given in the commentary.

results.title: Enterprise in Nigeria
results.creator_credit: Sydney Latter, Gerard Holdsworth and Unilever Films
results.brief_description: Nigeria, formerly an agricultural country, has a growing range of new industries giving Africans new opportunities and training facilities. With independence the process of industrialisation has accelerated. Shows how the United Africa Company, contributing capital and techniques in many different fields, is playing a part in the rapid development of the country. Traces the growth of industry in all three regions of Nigeria.
